You know, every now and then we get these storm warnings. The newspaper write about them, radio warns against them, on TV it's all "Lock up your pets and stay inside" etc. And then... nothing. Nada. A bit of wind, at most.

and THEN on other days, it's windy like WOAH, no warning, no nothing... just all of a sudden, it's pretty much storming outside. So I'd like to take a minute and make a little statement:
"What the hell, swedish meterologists?!"

Woke up around 6 am today because it was WINDY outside, living on the 7th floor my windows take quite the hits during those moments so it kind of makes a lot of noise and I couldn't sleep well. Walked Dunder a bit past 7 am and it was fairly bad then too, though calming down. Right now, 8:37 am, it doesn't seem bad at all.

Laundry day today, ugh. Gonna wash my rugs and shiz... then hopefully vaccuum and clean the fish tank and all that FUN stuff. Oh, speaking of though - my fishies had another litter and I'm excited over one fry in particular because it's BLACK. I mean, several of them tiny ones have dark pigment coming in already so I expect they'll be dark but one is pretty much solid black! That's neat because generally they are a sort of greyish/transparent colour at first. So I hope the lil guy (gal?) will make it and I'm curious to see its colours.
There are three bigger fry as well, they now swim the the adults like nobody's business. Two have a bit of black coming in on their tailfins but that's all I can see, the third has black and yellow/greenish. Since only one of my guppies have had that, I'm assuming he/she is the fry of my big dominant female!
For the tiny ones I expect my black male may be the sire, though I wonder if I've had him for a month already (how long guppies are preggers)!

btw you know what's annoying? Being all into showing & breeding at FP but not having any dogs at the right age to do it, haha! I wanna focus on cavaliers and would even be up to buying a few puppies, but there's nothing good for sale. I bought a slightly older male for kicks to see how far I'll get him, we'll see. Maybe I'll browse and buy two really old dogs (like in their 70s) and raise a few levels for kicks.

Time to go take care of laundry now, so I shall finish this reply like so XD

Yesterday I made up for not giving Dunder long walks lately - and then some! Morning - the long walk around the neighborhood, Dunder got to wear his backpack too.
Spent most of the day judging my conf and a few other things.
Then around 3 pm I walked to meet dad, he was picking me up to go to the farm, I was invited for dinner. Usually they pick me up outside the apartment, but I can also cross the whole area and walk down through another neighborhood and then a short bit through the woods, and meet dad there. That road is shorter to drive buuuut the woods portion, you can't drive through there, so I need to walk those 30-or-so min to get there. I do it when the weather is nice and such but it's not really an option when it's dark or similar.
So Dunder got antoher walk, backpack again - not that I brought a lot to the farm but it was quite handy to let him carry everythign for once, LOL!

Once at the farm I snuggled with the dogs, of course. Viggo is kinda my boy and he was soooo happy to see me - started to whine and stuff when I petted him haha! He's so funny, and such a sweet boy. Elsa is in heat at the moment and in a "I hate the world" type of mood but she was happy to see me too, as was Tina of course. And then SAGA. OMG, can we say crazy puppy?! She's like "OMFG YOU'RE MY BEST FRIEND" whenever someone (anyone, haha) greets her. And she's So. Damn. Cute! You can tell she's got more black coming in now, she's got like a dark stripe of heavier roaning on her upper body, it looks neat. Viggo likes her (except when she plays overly rough, which is most of the time) but Elsa doesn't care for her. They're pretty OK as long as Saga ignores her, f.ex. Saga sleeps in a crate, so when it's sleepy time they just close the crate door and Elsa can stand and glare at her in peace haha.

The cats have learnt to get along well too, they will follow each other around and play now, which is nice to see as Lakrits didn't like Findus at all at first. Haha, Findus is damn amusing. Once she jumped into the bath tub when mom was taking a bath. She stays mostly on the upper floor and had gone into the tub before - only then it was empty... needless to say she got quite the surprise when it was filled with water! She'sd done the same with the toilet too, actually, and twice at that - used to jumping onto it when the seat was down, but a couple of times it was up XD 

We had a traditional xmas dinner, may seem early but my parents have decided to stop having it at xmas instead, because it's a huge hassle to set up that sort of smorgasbord, a lot of it isn't the type of food lil kids love that much and so on... so now they just make a rather fancy dinner (compared to a normal one, at least!), one course that everyone likes you know? 
I also got lots of frozen foods, home made lasagna and some other stuff, from mom, yay! To bring to the apartment, I mean.

I also took Dunder for another 40 min or so walk while at the farm, so LOTS of walking for him yesterday! No complaints from him there...
Haha, when I was going home, I was standing waiting for dad, Dunder with his backpack. Both cats were out. Lakrits is curious about Dunder but keeps her distance. Now Findus just walked straight up to him, not the LEAST bit worried! Tail up and everything. Never seen a cat quite THAT unafraid of a strange dog, especially seeing how she's grown up with small dogs, never seen one as big as Dunder before! But yeah, she sniffed him all over and kinda just stayed near us. I held Dunder around his neck/front just in case he'd make a sudden movement - to be honest I don't think he knew what to do - he wasn't angry, but not wagging his tail either, as a matter of fact, he started to shake! I suppose he got excited... or nervous? Or terrified of the ickle cat? Who knows XD

So here's the deal;
I'm laying in bed watching TV. Suddenly I hear a knock and go and open the door. 2 women from this place you call when you are hearing a disturbing noise from your neighbor is there and say the've gotten a complaint about me. They have thick jackets with ID cards and the whole shebang. I go O.O but immediately apologize, figuring it's my TV, and promise to turn down the volume at once.
As I do so (and they have left), I realize that this sort of thumping noise (like a bass sound you know?) goes on... I realize it couldn't possibly come from my own tv and turn it off completely, and sure enough, it goes on still. I leave my apartment and look on all floors to see if the women are still here, but they are gone already. So basically, I just took the blame for something I didn't do! The noise continues for a while. I call various numbers trying to get hold of someone who can help me out but basically just get sent on to the next person over and over until I'm told to contact the guy who's sort of responsible for my apartmen building. Downside being that he only has phone hours from 8 - 9 am... 
So, tomorrow morning I gotta call him. I know this probably is not a huge deal but it got me really worked up and worried. From what I understood they are going to write a report on this, so I'm guessing it's going to say that I bothered my neighbours! And I'm worried if this will affect my future chances to rent or like, put me one step closer to being kicked out (I don't believe I'll be kicked out, but like... first step on the road, you know?) I tried to explain this on the phone, and I wrote a letter to the company I rent from, though I bet it's not going to do much good. I really hope "my guy" can explain this tomorrow and hopefully like, believe my version, you know? I realize it's pretty much my word against theirs, especially since I did sort of "take the blame" when they knocked, but that was surprise and since I WAS watching TV I figured I must have had the volume on too high. They did ask if I had speakers on the floor or something which I thought was a bit odd (like "it's THAT loud?!") but I don't and well, like I said, the noise continued after I turned my TV off!

Gah, why did this have to come RIGHT NOW? I'm not going to be able to sleep well at all tonight, I'm just sitting here being all worried over this all :( Most annoying of all is that normally I don't watch tv after 9 pm (this was at 10 pm), I just did tonight because there was this super interesting show on! If I hadn't had my TV on, I could just have told them so and they could have found the real culprit *sigh*

...did I put the clicker O.o Seriously, why have I ALWAYS managed to hide it when I need it?!
But first thing's first.
I was supposed to arrive early at my internship today because they were going to a church. So naturally one of the buses was late, meaning then I missed the final bus, which only goes once every 30 min... I found anumber and called them and sait to go on without me, I'd be late, and then once there (at 9 pm - I was supposed to be there at about 8...) I had to run and find this damned church. I was there last year so I had an idea on where to go (thank goodness, otherwise I don't know what I'd done - I don't know the neighborhood well at all), and thank goodness another group from another preschool were late too, so the ceremony itself hadn't started. Apologizes to my mentor, she was OK with it at least... 

Had a half day today (always on the first wednesday of every month cause we've other stuff we need to do). Went home and called the vet regarding Dunder - as far as vaccinations go, she wasn't impressed with the last one being in 2005 and said we may have to "start over" with him ie next one will be given in a shorter period of time and stuff? I thought that was slightly odd considering that even that insurance company said up to every 4 years, but oh well. They also said there's a slight risk we can't vaccinate him today, depending on the meds and such for it ears, whatever happens there. I'm fine with that. Lmao - I also asked if they could empty his anal glands, only in my tired mind I suddenly couldn't remember the word for it! I was like "and empty his anal... anal... you know?!" - "glands?" - "Yeah!" XD Gawd I felt stupid then haha. Dunder does actually have a slight history with that. He's never had a real infection or something but we've had the vet empty them a couple of times, he's having such a period now, biting around the root of his tail etc, so I figured they may as well do it while we're there.

And the best part - she had an available appointment at 3:30 pm today! So I'm leaving in about an hour. And well, I want the clicker because at the vet especially but honestly also the area around it + the bus/tram is going to be MASSIVE training for Dunder. I fully expect him to act like an ass at the vet too, heh. Pulling, being worried and so on. I know this is a lot for him to handle. The clicker lets me give him his focal point and makes it easier for me to steer his behaviour... so naturally now I can't find it, ugh! I actually have two clickers - and both are equally lost... the most annoying is I remember thinking that the spot I left it in last time wasn't my usual one, but I don't remember what this new spot was... I'll just go ahead without one, I guess.

Speaking of vets and such, the smoney situation has been FAIL lately. I've just had SO many unexpected costs, like the fish tank, and the Wii (fine, I saw that one coming but I didn't know I'd get so many other costs afterwards!), naturally I just go my electric bill and a few others etc. So this vet costs is another addition on that... but obviously Dunder can't walk around with hurting ears. 

Because I've been kinda stressed and on the move all day, I can't remain calm now either. I don't have to go to the vet yet for a good while, but I'm like ready to go now anyway! I suppose part of that is because while I've been to that vet loads of times before, I've never gone there by bus/tram, so I don't feel I know 100 % how that portion will go, you know? I think I shall have something to eat (will have dinner when home tonight but I already sort of skipped lunch so I need to eat something... like I said, a bit stressed out so I'm not in a mood to eat) and then walk Dunder-man and then go. Oh, and brush his coat first. Can't go to the vet with an iffy looking coat now can we? XD

EDIT: Woot, I found A clicker! I didn't find THE clicker, I found my old crappy one XD and I just tested it and the sound is a bit different... but Dunder's worked with both, I think it'll work. This one lacks the sweet band around my wrist which makes the other one easier to work with but I'll live...

Trimmed Dunder this morning - funny what a huge difference it made! I even did a "proper" spaniel trim, ie I didn't trim his back smooth... normally I just shave down his upper body, easier to deal with. I should have pulled off the dead hair but I don't know where the trimming knife is... He looks fab anyway! I also did laundry today and played Brawl... Lmao, so last night I decided to do All-star on "Intense" difficulty, which is the highest. I wanted to do it because you get one of the challenge rewards for it (the game has a bunch of challenges you can try to do). I had saved up lots of coins (you get them from winning fights etc) for extra continues etc so I was ready... Yeeeah it took forever, lmao. I think final time for all bosses ended at about 30 min - remember though that's for the times I WON a game - many stages I tried over and over and kept dying, so in total it's probably closer to an hour! And as you may remember if you read the last post, normally ALl-star takes 10-15 min on Easy difficulty. So yeah... And haha, afterwards you get a bit of music and screenshots and clips of the character you played as, and normally this voice says "Congratulations!" but when I beat it at Intense it said "Wow, incredible!" - Damn straight!!! I only have 2 or 3 characters left at All-star now, then I'll FINALLY be done with that portion of the game, ugh! I still have Classic which is much the same thing, in that you beat stages... the fighting stages are easier actually but you get to handle this nasty boss at the end, I do NOT look forward to doing that at Intense setting... Tomorrow we've a dog show! It's just a fun match, and we're just bringing Elsa. I'm actually nervous for once because Elsa, from what I've been told, does NOT like the table. So the story there... she used to be fine with it, I don't know why but she started to be a bit uncertain about it. Nothing happened that I know of, no incidents or falling off or anything. She has no problem dealing with people and no trouble climbing the furniture at home... Then mom and lil Sis took the dogs to a show because I couldn't be there that day, and Elsa for the first time freaked out on the table, did NOT like it at all. Maybe the rain and being with mom (who can't really handle a dog at a show) added to it. After that we took a pause showing her and I asked mom to keep training on keeping her on a table, according to mom she handles it just fine at home. It seems to be that combination of table + stranger + new place that she can't deal with. It's such a shame. I mean, if she was a large breed we wouldn't have to worry about it at all, but for a small dog, it can be devastating! Viggo's breeder have the same problem with a young dog they have. Gorgy dog, but freaks out on the table which ruins his whole gait etc because he gets so nervous. It's a big shame. So anyways, the other day Elsa was at the vet to get her vaccinations (1 year old now!). Mom told me she did NOT like the table there either. Plus she's been a bit freaked out by all the changes lately (Flizan gone, Saga has arrived etc) so quite frankly I don't expect her to even behave tomorrow... But at least I'm prepared for that?! It's good we're just bringing her too, I think, can focus on her then, would be trickier with Viggo, especially is she does feel uncertain and he catches on. So the plan is to basically go and try to make it a fun day for her, I'm hoping to ask the judge if they can be gentle with her on the table and maybe give her a treat etc... It's just a fun match, and a puppy show only for that matter so I hope they'll be understanding. We've entered both cavs in the MyDog show in january, it's this big show. We want Elsa to have at least one official result, but it'll really suck if we can't get it, or she can't be properly judged, just because of that stupid table! Viggo I've no worries about, granted he can't stack worth anything (wish I could train him but it's hard to train a dog you don't live with!) but he enjoys it and he sure can gait when he's a mind to. SO, wish us luck tomorrow, we'll need it!!!

So I've had a crazy week with lots to do, but you know what, I've finished it all! Or as well as I can, you know. SO WHEW life feels better haha. Still some things to worry about (like the next examination essay which ever creeps closer...) but I'm gonna try to relax this weekend. Internship begins on monday. Normally I live at the farm during that time but it won't work this time so I gotta travel from my apartment, which only takes 3 times as long (literally) *cough* At least it's just 2 weeks... And then examination, ugh!

Today I had a short day, just a seminary, then I cleaned the apartment (and did a good job too! So nice and clean!) and I bathed Dunder, which he didn't care for one bit (when I walked into the bathroom and called for him, he ran and hid in my bed lol!). Gonna try to try him tomorrow - I don't look forward to it one bit cause I'm gonna have hair ALL over my apartment when done but it seriously needs to be done...

Even though it's almost 11 pm I'm gonna play a bit of Super Smash Bros Brawl as soon as I'm done writing this. I've been working on finishing this thing called All-Star, basically you pick a character and beat all the other characters in the game, one by one or in small groups. It's like... 18 stages? 35 characters in total, takes 10-20 min usually depending on character, can take longer if you've chosen a harder setting too - I choose Easy just to plow through as quickly as possible. I've done maybe 20ish characters? I've not counted. More than half, but I've some left. Last time I played was as Ganondorf, he's made of fail because he's as fast as a drugged slug, ugh. Powerful attacks, though. At this point I'm not sure who my favourite is, according to the game stats I've played as Lucario the most, followed by Sonic X).
The reason I'm doing All Stars is that the game has a bunch of challenges, ranging from "Unlock 50 songs" to "play as luigi three times", "finish target smash level 3 with 10 characters" etc etc... and finishing all stars with all characters is one of them... I doubt I'll ever be able to finish them all because some are almost impossible but I've gotten fairly far now...

well, time to go play before it's waaaay too late!

So, after this morning's post *points down* life feels a bit better now that I'm home...
-Presentation went OK. Could have been better but it'll do. Teacher barely reflected over that she got our wok late, so I'm glad that we didn't get into more trouble for that.
-Mom's reserved Saga! She's an ickle roan cocker spaniel. So cute. But we need to drive roughly 283 km (about 3.5 hrs) tomorrow to pick her up... Me and mom are going. I'll be official puppy-holder in the car on the way home :P She's gonna be lil sis' dog. Mom told me her and the breeder chatted all morning nad it felt really right, the breeder and us kinda have the same view on things, you know? F.ex. she mentality test all her dogs, it's way harder to find that in a cocker breeder than it ought to be! And we DO have a problem with the temperament in the breed, so it's one of those things you truly wish more breeders worried about. But yeah, this breeder is all into that. After that chat mom also said to me she wants to mentality test Elsa next year. We've not been able to do it yet because the dog needs to be at least 1 year old and Elsa just turned that in october. And no point to do it in the middle of winter. Plus I wanna have Dunder done too for kicks and cause I think it'd be so interesting to see his reactions, so if we're lucky maybe we can get a chance to do 'em both this spring. Viggo already had it done as you know... I told mom maybe she should do it with Elsa, because she's very much mommy's dog and maybe if I keep her off leash she'll just run back to mom LOL. But I can handle her too if needed.

So even though I'm technically in the middle of semester, I've told myself I'm going to just relax and take it easy tonight, play the Wii and just enjoy life, you know? I think I need that because this week has just been so insane.

The fish are doing well btw. I actually removed one of them from the tank, one of my older females because she wasn't looking hot at all. I suppose the stress and well, everything that happened to her didn't work out too well. She had begun to grow a white spot and I feared it may be a disease and I really didn't want it spread to the others... Plus between her torn fins and being quite lethargic in general I thought it'd be best to get rid of her. I do miss the lil girl, she was pretty, blue/black spotted. The other girls are all doing fantastic though, large healthy fins and active and curious. I discussed guppies at the store yesterday when we bought the tank with one of the workers and we discussed how fun they are, they are so active and full of personality, you know? Curious about what goes on around them etc. Haha, sometimes when I sit and watch tv (tank's next to the bed) I'll glance to the side and the whole gang is staying as near me as possible!
I know it was a no-no but I actually bought 2 new males yesterday night... in my defense they are doing wonderfully. They are so pretty. I can't get good photos but they look much like this:
http://www.classycastle.com/guppies/better-blueboyyellowgirl.JPG (left one - not quite as large fins and a darker hue of blue, though)
http://zoology.okstate.edu/zoo_lrc/biol1114/study_guides/labs/lab14/guppies.jpg - See the one about in the middle, a bit to the right, that's mostly black with a white head? Much like that, only some blueish stripes on the front/middle as well. Very pretty!
Right now they are trying to convince the ladies that they should "get to know each other" so they seem content enough in their new home!

Yeah this week has been kind of crazy, honestly I'm all out of energy and everything just feels like crap right now. Though I think it'll feel better tonight...

The light right now is that my parents are talking about getting a cocker puppy. The breed is a pain in the ass 70 % of the time but the rest they are such fantastic dogs we just can't live without one. We've found a super nice kennel that have a bitch puppy available, and the crazy thing is, it's the exact colour, and even is nicknamed the name my sister had in mind when she described what she wanted! The downside is the kennel is located across the country, but the breeder is going to a show (tomorrow, mom thinks) and if so we could meet almost half way (well, not quite, but better than visiting her in person, talking distance). If so, I'd like going with mom tomorrow to see the puppy. So right now I'm trying to think "happy cocker thoughts" lol. I'm SO glad we've only class for a few hours today, gah I need to go home and just rest from all the drama this week...

Last night Buddy came over after work (about 7:30 pm) and we had dinner (lasagna with garlic bread mmm) and played the Wii. It was lots of fun! It took a while for us to manage to synchronize the remotes, though - at first Buddy did it the way she thought one should do it, end result being that neither remote worked! But we found the manual and figured it out, heh. We only had time to play for about an hour and a half or so but it was a lot of fun. Just got off the cell talking to mom - she's made a vet appointment for Flizan on monday. As I'm sure you know she has some massive fear aggression to the point we can't groom her. Like, last time she was trimmed (maybe a year ago) dad helped out, and even now dad can't hold her without her panicking. And I mean, it's not like they were all violent and mean to her - we're talking cuddling and reassuring. If I try to hold her against her will, she'll scream, snap wildly and wet herself. She's really extreme, and while she's better than she used to be, any situation that requires her to be held still, or touched (beyond a simple petting) will have her freak out. So, on monday she's going to the vet, filled up with drugs until she's sleeping and then they'll trim her, clean her ears, clip her claws and all that. It's just the kindest thing to do for her - as little stress as possible. The vet said there's are meds that could help her calm down, which we are going to try, though they also said for a dog that's so extreme they may not help much. But like I said, my parents want to at least try it. Just this vet visit will cost $250... They're not sure how often they can take Flizan to have this done, it's a lot of money, and there's always a slight risk involved with anesthesia... I mean I trimmed Nellie every 2 months, not an option with Flizan. But like the vet said, maybe if we get her completely shaven down now, and the meds... maybe it'll make it easier next time. We'll see. Day off today! Or well, study from home, but whatever, heh. I started the morning by walking 'round the whole neighborhood with Dunder. I've been pretty good at doing that, I've done it almost every day or a week or so? At this point it doesn't even feel like that long a walk, especially since I try to keep a good pace. I doubt anyone but me cares but it's my blog so I'll list the changes anyway :P - While a rule was, naturally, that you mustn't mistreat your dogs, it's been changed to "dogs or other animals". So if you, for insance, mistreat your cat, it's considered breaking the Swedish kennel club's rules (if you're a member) -To not be rude/diss other specific members. Of course you can't control what people say, but this is about pointing out and completely dissing another kennel club member publically and openly, like on a website. The kennel club are however aware of the difficulty between free speech and openly dissing someone -To not do something in order to affect the results/judging of a dog, not speak ill of other dogs, members of workers - before the rules were read as on meaning on the day/place of the trial only. Now it will also apply before/after the trial. -Not register puppies in another's name, not use others as middle man sellers or act like a middle man seller or buy such a dog - before the rule affected "breeders". Now it affects "every member". -The portion regarding ethical breeding has a new introduction and some rephrasing (there's lots more, of course - just quoting new additions, or updated phrasing) "Dog breeding should be done in a way that benefits the offsprings' health and wellbeing" "Only use dogs for breeding that do not have a serious disease, disability and have a good, for the breed typical, temperament" "When brreeding avoid combinations that heighten the risk for serious disease or disability in the ofsfspring" "As an owner follow SKK's health program. For breeds that require veterinary/genetic proof and/or passed mentality testing should have proof of such available before the breeding takes place" "To not use dog for breeding that has proven through DNA-testing to carry double genes for a serious disease that is inherited reccessively. Dog that is shown to be a carrier of a single gene for serious disease that is inherited in a recessive manner can be bred but only when combined with dogs that are not carriers and providing this agrees with the breed's health program" "To follow the rules of the country where artifical insemination is performed, but never by anyone but a certified vet. In Sweden the vet needs a permit from Jordbruksverket to be allowed to perform inseminations" -More under breeder's ethics: "To not use dam/stud for breeding until age where the dog is physically and mentally grown" "Not breed a bitch at too high a age, which is dependant on breed" "Not let bitch give birth to more than five litters. If a bitch has two litters within 12 months she must then be given at least 12 months of rest before next litter. Bitch over 7 years old must rest at least 12 months between each litter" "A breeder should make sure that each puppy before being sold has an enivornment that stimulates the physical and mental development and a good socialization with both man and dog" sounds good to me :)
